descriptions.description: More core developers increase the availability of mentors, facilitating implicit knowledge transfer.
A larger pool of new contributors increases the potential inflow of individuals who can become experienced.
As new contributors skill up, they flow out of the 'New Contributors' stock into more experienced roles.
Developer turnover directly reduces the number of core developers through departures from the project.
A higher promotion rate increases the core developer stock by moving experienced contributors into core roles.
Promoting experienced contributors to core roles reduces the stock of experienced contributors.
The skill-up flow increases the stock of experienced contributors by transitioning new contributors into this role.
Better explicit documentation accelerates learning, thereby increasing the rate at which contributors skill up.
Effective mentorship accelerates practical skill development, increasing the rate at which contributors skill up.
Mentorship builds the necessary skills and social capital for experienced contributors to be promoted.
